New Records: Jeffrey Vandersay took a six-wicket haul in the match.
Key Match Events: Jeffrey Vandersay's six-wicket haul was a major performance.
Charith Asalanka dismissed key Indian batsmen including Mohammed Siraj, Washington Sundar, and Axar Patel.
India experienced a middle-order collapse after a good start.
Washington Sundar and Axar Patel had a 38-run partnership that tried to bring India back into the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma and Co were looking to clinch their first win in the ODI series against Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga was ruled out due to a hamstring injury and Jeffrey Vandersay was named as his replacement.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's victory by 32 runs was a massive confidence booster for the team.
India needs to improve their batting performance to level the series in the third ODI.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka defended a target of 241 runs on a tricky surface.
Sri Lanka's bowlers, especially spinners, dominated the game-play.
